name: Hyacinthus
description: Hyacinthus is a small genus of three species of bulbous flowering plants in the Asparagaceae family, native to Mediterranean and Middle East.The plant has narrow leaves that are folded lengthwise, and highly attractive and fragrant flowers which are borne in a raceme cluster at the top of the leafless stems. Hyacinthus, commonly known as Hyacinth, is extremely popular and praised because of its unique, rich and heavy scent. Hyacinths are great for gardens, as well as for bouquets and arrangements.
meaning: The genus was named after a famous Greek hero from Greek mythology – Hyacinth.
color_description: Hyacinth comes in many color varieties, such as purple, blue, white, yellow, red, pink and orange.
